channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: Charities face hefty revenue cuts due to lockdown
item.description: The SPCA has taken a hit of about $1 million and the RSA looks likely to lose about $2m, as the lockdown restricts fundraising and gaming trust support.

item.title: Orana Wildlife Park describes appeal response as 'incredible'
item.description: Online donations for Christchurch's Orana Wildlife Park have topped $129,200, as it grapples to afford food, habitat maintenance, heating and vet bills during lockdown.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from NZ and around the world on 20 April
item.description: The Early Childhood Council has written an open letter to the Prime Minister asking for ECE centres to remain closed until the country moves to alert level 2.

item.title: Nine new Covid-19 cases as lockdown decision nears
item.description: There are nine new cases of Covid-19 in the country today and no new deaths, the Ministry of Health says.

item.title: Covid-19: Your alert level 3 questions answered
item.description: Described by some as level 4 but with KFC, whenever we move to level 3 there are still many rules to understand and follow. Glen Scanlon answers your level 3 questions.

item.title: Tasman powers on with Waimea hydro dam
item.description: Tasman is powering ahead with an idea to build a hydro electricity station on the Waimea Community Dam south of Richmond.

item.title: Covid-19: Air New Zealand crew self-isolate after physical distancing rule breach
item.description: A number of Air New Zealand crew members have been told to self-isolate after some staff may have disregarded physical distancing rules during a layover in Vancouver.

item.title: Family harm callouts dominate Dunedin police work in lockdown
item.description: While family harm has continued to dominate emergency calls during lockdown in Dunedin, police have also dealt with a number of level 4 breaches.

item.title: Covid-19: Man charged with attempting to infect three police officers
item.description: An Auckland man has been charged with attempting to infect three police officers with Covid-19 by spitting on them.

item.title: Families split by Covid-19 border restrictions
item.description: Most of the requests for exceptions to the country's tough border restrictions are being refused, according to figures from Immigration New Zealand.

item.title: Residential aged care sector understaffed - union
item.description: A union representing residential aged care workers says there has been no consultation from the Ministry of Health on what an extra $26 million in funding is for.

item.title: Covid-19: Principals warn students could fall behind with remote learning
item.description: Secondary principals are worried students from poor families and those studying practical subjects are falling behind as they contemplate several more weeks of remote learning.

item.title: Lifting Covid-19 lockdown: Long weekend breaks 'a risky thing to do' - virus modeller
item.description: New Zealand's alert level 4 lockdown should be continued for another two weeks to strengthen chances of eliminating Covid-19, says an expert on modelling how the coronavirus spreads.

item.title: Estimated power bills may be a shock for some - Consumer NZ
item.description: People faced with higher power bills during the lockdown need to approach their power companies to discuss payment options, Consumer NZ says.

item.title: Health Ministry consults with spy agency GCSB for Covid-19 tracing, amid privacy concerns
item.description: The Health Ministry has been consulting with the GCSB over tracing people as it works to get its Covid-19 systems up to speed.

item.title: Police shoot man wielding machete in South Auckland
item.description: A man with a machete has been shot dead by police in South Auckland.

item.title: Covid-19: Is it too soon to relax the lockdown?
item.description: As New Zealand prepares for a potential drop in alert levels, some people think it is too soon to be relaxing the standard.

item.title: Patients miss out on surgery under Covid-19 lockdown
item.description: An estimated 30,000 people have missed out on surgery because of the Covid-19 lockdown.
